title: WCAS PSYCH 215-0-20 Psychology of Personality
class_attributes:
Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will provide an overview of neural processes underlying emotional and social processes. The course will include discussion of contemporary theories of social-emotional processes, 21st century methods for examining the social-emotional brain (e.g., MRI, PET, ERP, EEG), the circuits in the brain underlying the experience of emotion, biological mechanisms underlying social-emotional disorders (depression, anxiety, autism), neuroplasticity, and future directions in the study of the social-emotional brain. The course is introductory in nature and it is not expected that students have previous courses in either neuroscience or affective science.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be three non-cumulative exams for the course. All exams will involve both multiple choice and short answer responses. The third and final non cumulative exam will be held during final exam week.
